data.title: Great food!
data.text: Food is very very good, atmosphere is nice and service is excellent. We are vegetarians and we very much liked the offering and taste. This was the first time we went all the way from Appetizer to Dessert in a Thai restaurant and we loved them all.

data.title: Very Good!
data.text: First time here.  We had the spring rolls, the chicken satay, shrimp pad Thai, and the Pad See Ew.  All excellent.  Fresh ingredients, great service, not a long wait at all.  We will be back to try some other items on the menu.

data.title: Not a quick lunch stop!
data.text: Definitely not a quick stop for lunch place. Slow service, took almost an hour to get the order. Requested no meat as we are vegetarians but the entrée still smelled of fish and meat, probably because the same wok was used to prepare the dish. The Spicy Basil Fried Rice and Pad Thai were average in taste. The only positive was that the waitress was very friendly.

data.title: One of the best Pad Thai
data.text: Very clean and neat restaurant. I read the reviews and went for lunch. With good reviews I expected the food to be good but I did not expect it to be more than goo. Really liked the pad thai. I hope other items on the menu are as good as pad Thai.

data.title: Very Disappointed
data.text: We checked out Lotus Leaf when they first opened. I stopped in to pick up a take out menu and spoke with the owner/chef for quite a while. He explained how only the finest ingredients were used and how he was trained in NY. We were so excited thinking we had finally found a place near home with good Thai food. BOY were we disappointed! There was nothing outstanding about the dishes we ordered. I agree with the other reviewer who classified this as Asian fusion food. Not close to authentic Thai food. I thought it was very pricey and rather mundane. We should all expect our food to be fresh when we eat at a restaurant, it should not be a special issue. And yes, a limited menu. Another bland excuse for Thai. Guess we will still have to go to St. Louis Park or Minneapolis for decent Thai.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Third visit, and really love the food. Tofu and shrimp pad Thai are fantastic, and I love the egg rolls. Not the largest menu, but what they do isn't "industrial thai".

data.title: Disappointed with Lotus Leaf!
data.text: We were excited to see a Thai restaurant in Eden Prairie, other than the mediocre one by the bus depot.  The food was excellent but for the price the portions were very small.  The Panang Curry had great flavor but didn't have much chicken in it.   My husband had the Pork belly ramen and paid extra for more pork belly and had a total of 4 pieces.  We will continue to make the trek to Wok in the Park in St Louis Park for amazing Thai with generous portions and probably won't return to Lotus Leaf!

data.title: Okay Thai....limited menu.
data.text: My husband and I were excited to have a new Thai option in Eden Prairie. We visited on a cold Saturday night and we're pleased to be able to be seated right away. The food was decent but a very limited menu. I tried the pad Thai, it was very sweet. My husband had a wide rice noodle dish which he liked, wish they had more stir fry options.

data.title: Outstanding Thai with a focus on quality
data.text: A really refreshing addition to the Eden Prairie dining scene.  Refined Thai with superior ingredients.  Authentic flavors with a clear focus on superior ingredients.  Much more consistent in terms of quality versus the other Thai option in town.

data.title: Not Thai!  Sweet Asian Fusion!
data.text: Thai cuisine should not be referred to at all with this restaurant. Too much sugar!  My sticky rice was a lump of hot sludge.  My white rice was starchy and fused together.  Thai Jasmine rice should be fresh. Everything on the plate was Chinese/Americanized over sweetened. Garlic Shrimp $15 for lunch. Uff Dah!

data.title: Overpriced, Portentous Thai
data.text:
I did not enjoy my overpriced meal at this restaurant. 

The menu was limited; no vegetarian options. The dishes that we were served were presented poorly - ugly glass plates, bizarre garnish, not enough rice. The food also just wasn't that good. The breathy pop music blaring in this empty-feeling restaurant was almost unbearable.

data.title: EDEN PRAIRIE WAKE UP TO A NEW TASTE EXPERIENCE
data.text: We happened upon their soft opening and we were glad we did!  The food was amazing!!!!  I had the Panang Curry with free range chicken, fresh cut pineapple Tthai basil and sweet peppers.  It was delectible! So fresh my head was singing!  My table members had Cashew Chicken and Massaman Curry.  They both devoured their meals.  The presentation of the various meals at our table were beautiful and eye popping.  The front of the house service was very inviting and friendly too.  You don't have to go anywhere else to get outstanding Thai food.  The entress range from $10 to $18 dollars.  This is the new hidden gem in Eden Prairie!!!!  I will definitely be putting this on my short list!  Oh yeah, they do take out too!
